Column Comment.0: LINE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a line that describes the spatial extent of alinear object such as a seismic line, pipeline, road etc.
Column Comment.1: POINT SEQ NO: Unique identifier for the points of the line, ordered spatially.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: POINT OBSERVATION NUMBER: A observation number used to differentiatebetween versions of the coordinates of a specific point.
Column Comment.4: ACQUISITION IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for the coordinate acquisition.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: AREA IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a state, county, country, province etc that isa reference point for this survey location.
Column Comment.7: AREA TYPE: The type of area that is a reference point for a survey location, such ascounty, country, state, province, emirate etc.
Column Comment.8: EASTING: The X coordinate for the node with respect to the point of origin of thespecified map projection.
Column Comment.9: EASTING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Easting value.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the version became effective.
Column Comment.11: ELEVATION: The elevation of the node relative to the well datum (usually Mean SeaLevel), Used when the node position is the Surface Location.
Column Comment.12: ELEVATION OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Elevation.
Column Comment.13: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.15: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.16: LATITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, north or south of the equator. Apositive value represents a north latitude.
Column Comment.17: LEGAL SURVEY TYPE: The survey type used for legal descriptions. For example,Carter, Congressional, Dominion Land Survey, ...
Column Comment.18: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.19: LOCATION QUALIFIER: A description of the type of location. For example, Actual,Theoretical, Original, Contract, ... (but not Rationalized).
Column Comment.20: LOCATION QUALITY: Indicates the quality or degree of reliablity of a location.
Column Comment.21: LONGITUDE: Angular distance in decimal degrees, east or west of the primemeridian of the Geodetic Datum. A negative value represents west longitude.
Column Comment.22: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.23: MEASURED DEPTH: Can be used for types of points that have a measured depth,as appropriate (not just for well bores). For example, the depth measured along thewellbore path relative to the Measurement Datum specified in the well row. Used fordownhole node position values.
Column Comment.24: MEASURED DEPTH OUOM: Measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: MONUMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the monument,in the event that the monument is used as a reference.
Column Comment.26: MONUMENT SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: part of the FK from SF MONUMENT.
Column Comment.27: NODE POSITION: The position on a wellbore path. For example: surface point,bottomhole point, kick-off point, ....
Column Comment.28: NORTHING: The Y coordinate for the node location with respect to the point of originof the specified map projection.
Column Comment.29: NORTHING OUOM: Original unit of measure for the Northing value.
Column Comment.30: NORTH TYPE: The North reference used in surveying to define angularmeasurements. For example, True North, Magnetic North, Grid North, AstronomicalNorth, ...
Column Comment.31: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.32: ORIGINAL POSITION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this position is theoriginal location information for a point. This information may be required for historicalor reporting purposes.
Column Comment.33: ORIGINAL REFERENCE NUMBER: The original reference number that is assignedto this point.
Column Comment.34: POLAR AZIMUTH: Value for the azimuth direction of polar offset, measured inangular degrees with a clockwise offset from true (geographic) north.
Column Comment.35: POLAR OFFSET: The map distance from the surface location to a point above thebottom hole location
Column Comment.36: POLAR OFFSET OUOM: Polar offset original unit of measure.
Column Comment.37: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.38: PREFERRED INDICAATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this column is a preferredlocation version.
Column Comment.39: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.40: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported straight line depth of the nodemeasured relative to the Measurement Datum specified in the Well row.
Column Comment.41: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH OUOM: True vertical depth original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.42: VERSION TYPE: the type of version, such as actual, theoretical, orginal, agreed,rational etc.
Column Comment.43: X COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a mapping co-ordinate
Column Comment.44: X OFFSET: Offset distance, in the east/west (X) direction from the surface location ofthe well. Used when the node position is a downhole point and the well is deviated.
Column Comment.45: X OFFSET OUOM: X distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.46: Y COORDINATE: Optional for insertion of a Y co-ordinate for mapping
Column Comment.47: Y OFFSET: Distance, In the north/south (Y) direction from the surface of the well.Used for a downhole node position and for deviated wells.
Column Comment.48: Y OFFSET OUOM: Y distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.49: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.50: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.51: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.52: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.53: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.54: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.55: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
